alert.note: Alert for Le Flore (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 27 at 12:50AM CST by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southwestern Franklin, Sebastian and Le Flore Counties through 115 AM CST... At 1249 AM CST, Doppler radar indicated strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Spiro to 10 miles south of Whitesboro. Movement was east at 65 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down small tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations in or near the path include... Fort Smith... Poteau... Charleston... Greenwood... Pocola... Heavener... Spiro... Panama... Mansfield... Wister... Hackett... Howe... Hartford... Huntington... Bonanza... Midland... Cameron... Octavia... Big Cedar... Excelsior... MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 100 AM CST for southeastern Oklahoma.
